div.h2: Board of Examinations for Seafarers Trust
div.h3: All India Exit Examination for Ratings

div.h2: Board of Examinations for Seafarers Trust
div.h3: All India Exit Examination for Ratings December 2023

div.style: display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; margin-top: 30px; margin-bottom: 30px;

h4.style: margin-left: 100px; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: underline; text-align: left;

div.h5: 1. Report on the All India Exit Examination
div.p: 1.1 Online test Venues/ Invigilators: The online test for all candidates was conducted at the respective institutes. In all cases, either BES or empaneled invigilators, supervised the process. The test had a full coverage of the syllabus in both GP and CCMC. GP online test consists of 45 minutes for GSK and 45 minutes for MEK. CCMC online test is of 60 minutes duration.

1.2 Incidents of unfair means in the online test:
NIL
In all, 4659(4350) candidates applied, of which 4651(4339) candidates appeared. 3980(3641) candidates passed. The overall result is 85.6% (83.9%).
Subject Wise Pass Percentage OF GP Rating Examination For 50 Institutes Is As Follows;

td.style: text-align: left;
text-align: center;

div.h6: > Oral and Practical were conducted at 50 training for GP and 18 training institute for CCMC between
> Online Examination was conducted at respective institute between
div.p: BES has been continuously striving to improve the process of examination and encouraging institutes to improve their infrastructure and training.
BES wishes "Thank You" to The Directorate General of Shipping for continuing support and guidance.
